links.title: Culture
links.intro: The Culture series is a science fiction series written by Scottish author Iain M. Banks and released from 1987 through to 2012. The stories centre on The Culture, a utopian, post-scarcity space society of humanoid aliens, and advanced superintelligent artificial intelligences living in artificial habitats spread across the Milky Way galaxy.

links.title: Fresco, Jacque
links.intro: Fresco wrote and lectured his views on sustainable cities, energy efficiency, natural-resource management, cybernetic technology, automation, and the role of science in society. He directed the Venus Project and advocated global implementation of a socioeconomic system which he referred to as a "resource-based economy".

links.title: Koto Co-Op
links.intro: A community and a business working on/exploring/researching exponential growth to fund and implement living spaces, social constructs, designs and technology needed to go towards post-scarcity gift economy.

links.title: NEXTKIND
links.intro: A society actively working towards post-scarcity.

links.title: The Post-Scarcity World of 2050-2075
links.intro: The world economy will experience scarcities of natural resources from now until the middle of the twenty-first century, when a post-scarcity world becomes a reality, according to an international team of futurists.

links.title: The Venus Project
links.intro: The Venus Project is a non-profit organization that presents a new socio-economic model utilizing science and technology toward social betterment to achieve a sustainable civilization of abundance for all, without exception.

links.title: Walkaway
links.intro: Set in our near-future, it is a story of walking away from "non-work", and surveillance and control by a brutal, immensely rich oligarchical elite; love and romance; a post-scarcity gift economy; revolution and eventual war; and a means of finally ending death.

links.title: The Zeitgeist Movement
links.intro: A global, grassroots sustainability movement seeking holistic change for better wellbeing for everyone.
